title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: vignette demonstrates use covidanalysis package analyzing outbreak timing distributions breach pathways COVID-19 border quarantine systems. analysis based computational models developed Zachreson et al. (2022) simulate quarantine operations community transmission dynamics. timing outbreak events following quarantine breaches depends several key parameters system, including vaccination coverage vaccine efficacy. source breach, whether originating travellers quarantine workers, also affects overall risk profile. Understanding relationships essential assessing effectiveness quarantine measures.

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: use package, install first GitHub: load package data:
code: remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-Jingwei-z") library(covidanalysis) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  data(ob_timings) data(ob_timings_summary) data(ob_probs_travellers)  head(ob_timings) #>   breach_times R0  VE coverage #> 1    43.643333  5 0.5      0.1 #> 2    85.240000  5 0.5      0.1 #> 3    32.470000  5 0.5      0.1 #> 4     8.676667  5 0.5      0.1 #> 5    12.136667  5 0.5      0.1 #> 6   113.160000  5 0.5      0.1 head(ob_timings_summary) #>   R0  VE coverage t50_days  t95_days #> 1  5 0.5      0.1 46.27000 198.82600 #> 2  6 0.5      0.1 29.48333 128.46667 #> 3  7 0.5      0.1 25.76167 108.34800 #> 4  8 0.5      0.1 20.28667  87.98933 #> 5  9 0.5      0.1 15.72000  68.72667 #> 6 10 0.5      0.1 15.06333  64.61433 head(ob_probs_travellers) #>   R0  VE coverage traveller_ob_prob worker_ob_prob #> 1  5 0.5      0.1           0.00903        0.14613 #> 2  6 0.5      0.1           0.01352        0.16433 #> 3  7 0.5      0.1           0.01370        0.17484 #> 4  8 0.5      0.1           0.01881        0.18244 #> 5  9 0.5      0.1           0.02028        0.19702 #> 6 10 0.5      0.1           0.02102        0.20334

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: package includes three datasets sourced Zenodo (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.5802433). ob_timings dataset contains raw breach times computational simulations. combination R₀, vaccine efficacy (VE), population coverage, multiple outbreak simulations conducted, producing distribution possible breach times. ob_timings_summary dataset distills distribution two key statistics: t50_days t95_days. represent 50th 95th percentiles outbreak timing distribution. 50th percentile indicates median time outbreak, 95th percentile captures upper bound typical range. Together, form confidence interval describing outbreaks occur given conditions. ob_probs_travellers dataset quantifies different aspect: probability infected individual successfully breaches quarantine initiates community transmission. probabilities reported separately travellers workers, reflecting different detection regimes faces. Travellers undergo testing specific days may exit false-negative results. Workers attend intermittently face regular testing attendance days, creating different breach risk profile.

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: relationship vaccination parameters outbreak timing can explored filtering specific scenarios: shows , fixed R0 6 50% population coverage, increasing vaccine efficacy extends median upper percentile outbreak timing. distance t50 t95 represents spread distribution.

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: protective effect vaccination becomes clear visualizing percentile ranges across coverage levels: Outbreak timing distribution ranges across vaccination coverage Solid lines represent median outbreak time (t50), dashed lines represent 95th percentile (t95). Different colors indicate different vaccine efficacy levels. vertical separation lines indicates width distribution. coverage increases vaccine efficacy improves, curves shift upward, indicating outbreaks become less likely near term.
code: ob_timings_summary %>%   filter(R0 == 6) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = coverage, color = factor(VE))) +   geom_line(aes(y = t50_days), size = 1, linetype = "solid") +   geom_line(aes(y = t95_days), size = 1, linetype = "dashed") +   scale_y_log10() +   scale_color_viridis_d(name = "Vaccine\nEfficacy", labels = function(x) paste0(as.numeric(x) * 100, "%")) +   labs(     title = "Outbreak Timing Distribution (R0 = 6)",     x = "Population Vaccination Coverage",     y = "Days (log scale)",     subtitle = "Solid lines show median (t50), dashed lines show 95th percentile (t95)"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "right") #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: probability breaches differs travellers workers due different exposure testing patterns: Traveller-initiated breaches consistently show lower probability worker-initiated breaches parameter values. reflects structured testing regime travellers upon entry exit. However, pathways remain relevant risk assessment, neither disappears entirely even high vaccination levels.
code: breach_data <- ob_probs_travellers %>%   filter(R0 == 6, coverage == 0.5) %>%   select(VE, traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob) %>%   arrange(VE)  print(breach_data) #>    VE traveller_ob_prob worker_ob_prob #> 1 0.5           0.01081        0.14173 #> 2 0.6           0.00815        0.12127 #> 3 0.7           0.00468        0.09207 #> 4 0.8           0.00289        0.06162 #> 5 0.9           0.00111        0.03321

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: outbreak timing distributions demonstrate vaccination extends protection timelines substantially. 95th percentile values particularly important planning purposes, represent scenarios outbreaks take longer manifest median case. Worker-initiated breaches represent persistent risk pathway entirely eliminated vaccination alone. reflects biological reality: breakthrough infections occur even vaccinated individuals, workers facility contact face ongoing exposure. distinction traveller worker pathways informs design testing isolation protocols within quarantine systems.

title: COVID-19 Border Quarantine Analysis
text: Shiny application accompanying package enables exploration relationships across full parameter space. selecting different R0 values, vaccine efficacy levels, coverage percentages, users can observe outbreak timing distributions breach probabilities change. interactive framework supports evidence-based evaluation quarantine policies different epidemiological vaccination scenarios.
